Pre-Game Insights: Experts predict India as the favorites given their home advantage.
India's top gun mavericks have led by example, showcasing the mentality of true warriors.
South Africa's batting unit has been a phenomenal unit in the ongoing edition of the fray, with a scoring rate of 11 plus.
India's bowlers have proved time and time again that they can be the game-changer, with Bhuvneshwar Kumar leading the show.
South Africa's bowling unit boasts of tantamount brilliance, featuring the prized quartet of Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, Lungi Ngidi and Wayne Parnell.

Expect some unprecedented pyrotechnics as two of the finest teams in Group 2 take the yard, hoping to present you all with a crackerjack of a contest featuring an intense bout of pace and drift while the batters make it a point to bring out their class.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Optus Stadium hasn't played host to many T20Is so far and the average score batting first ranges at a modest 142 while the team chasing has so far averaged 141.
The highest score registered batting first at Optus is 208 by England while the highest score chased down so far has been 158.
Others: Virat Kohli vs Wayne Parnell: Virat has been poetic so far as his brilliance has gunned down the Falcon with extreme prejudice in the tournament opener while taking on the inexperienced Netherlands bowlers without much fuss.

Suryakumar Yadav vs Kagiso Rabada: Another incredible battle to witness in the upcoming contest will be India’s in-form SKY whose 360-degree approach has left the bowlers scratching their heads while Kagiso Rabada’s lethal use of those chin-rattling bumpers can be a perfect match for Surya’s constant shuffle inside the crease.

Quinton de Kock vs Bhuvneshwar Kumar: This would be the bloodiest exchange of haymakers as roaring QDK who is South Africa’s highest run scorer in the ongoing tournament with 110 runs will be taking on Bhuvi Kumar who has already been India’s trump card in the powerplay.
Head-to-head: Matches played: 23, India: 13, South Africa: 9
